intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris subsp. bursa-pastoris, commonly known as chickweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are oval to kidney-shaped. The plant produces small white or pink flowers with four petals, followed by distinctive triangular seed pods. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in gardens, fields, and along roadsides. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a common weed in various habitats.
